Simone Maria Giancola's webpage

Hello world!

Paris, France;

currently no institutional address

(from nov ‘25) I am a PhD student in statistics at the Orsay Institute, Paris-Saclay University, supervised by Christophe Giraud and Nicolas Verzelen.

  • 📝 Give a look at my publication(s) page.

  • 🛠 I like statistical-to-computational gaps, and reading about methods from physics and probability mixing up.

  • 👨‍💻 Some notes are in my writings window.

other

  • 🌊 Check this blog post if you want to read about what I like outside of research.
  • 🎨 The prompt I gave to Dall-E2 for the surprisingly self resembling image was

    “Van Gogh style painting of an Italian boy in his 20s with a shirt and eyeglasses, brown curly hair, brown eyes”

Perhaps I am an approximate ground state of some Open AI’s ML model…

previously

In 2024, I was a research intern @KAUST in Prof. Richtárik’s group, focusing on optimization.

In 2023, I was a research intern @ENS Paris under the supervision of Bruno Loureiro, exploring stochastic gradient descent dynamics beyond the unstructured assumption. Before in the same year, I was a research intern @IST Austria under the supervision of Prof. Marco Mondelli, where I worked on approximate message passing and information theoretic limits of a model of inference.

I graduated with an M2 in probability and statistics, Université Paris-Saclay, Institut de Mathématique d’Orsay. Supervisor(s) were my current advisor(s). I also hold an MS in data science from Bocconi University. My supervisor was Prof. Carlo Lucibello. Before my graduate studies, I completed a bachelor in economics and computer science.

visitors are from

news

Jul 1, 2025 I will continue with a PhD in statistics at the Orsay institute! We will work on the low-degree method. Starting in November after a short break.
Aug 27, 2024 Starting September, I will move to Paris and engage in a very advanced set of classes. Quite excited.
Apr 15, 2024 Thrilled to make a meta-update! This month, I have graduated from Bocconi university with a MS in data science! Thanks to my awesome supervisor Carlo Lucibello for 5 years of mentorship. Since February I am also interning at KAUST in Prof. Richtárik’s group, focusing on optimization!
Dec 26, 2023 Came back home for the holidays, happy to see family and friends. I will take some time to finish my thesis and some documents I have been writing up, as well as continue with the Austrian and French research. Stay tuned for new destinations!
Oct 1, 2023 very excited to share that I will continue as a research intern at École Normale Supérieure (ENS). I will be in Bruno Loureiro’s group and work on stochastic gradient descent for structured data.
Feel free to reach out via e-mail!
